cui_name: Renal artery stenosis with renovascular hypertension
reasoning: Renal artery stenosis (RAS) causing hypertension: incidence ~2 per 100k in general population, prevalence higher at ~0.5-0.6% of hypertensives (~45 per 100k in this subpopulation). Reports both metrics: incidence of new cases and prevalence of condition burden. Atherosclerotic RAS increases with age.
source: Hirsch AT et al. (2012). ACC/AHA 2005 Practice Guidelines for the Management of Patients with Peripheral Arterial Disease. J Am Coll Cardiol. 47(6):1239-1312
